content: Chinese violinist **Chen Da Wei** is a Chinese violinist serving as [first violinist](/wiki/First_violin) in the [Singapore Symphony Orchestra](/wiki/Singapore_Symphony_Orchestra). Born in [Shanghai](/wiki/Shanghai), Chen began studies on the violin at the age of eight. His teacher was [Tan Shuzhen](/wiki/Tan_Shuzhen), a well-known violin professor at the [Shanghai Conservatory of Music](/wiki/Shanghai_Conservatory_of_Music). Chen Da Wei was also a prize winner in the Shanghai Young Musician Competition. Chen was previously with the [Shanghai Symphony Orchestra](/wiki/Shanghai_Symphony_Orchestra) for eight years before joining the Singapore Symphony Orchestra in 1989. - Singapore Symphony Orchestra biography - Chen Da Wei at [AllMusic](/wiki/AllMusic_(identifier)) This article on a Chinese musician is a stub. title: Chen Da Wei
